ai_workflows.document_utilities module

Utilities for reading and processing documents for AI workflows.

class ai_workflows.document_utilities.DocumentInterface(llm_interface: LLMInterface = None)

Bases: object

Utility class for reading and processing documents for AI workflows.

__init__(llm_interface: LLMInterface = None)

Initialize the document interface for reading and processing documents.

Parameters:

llm_interface (LLMInterface) – LLM interface for interacting with LLMs in AI workflows (defaults to None, which won’t use an LLM to convert supported document types to markdown).

Convert a document to markdown.

Returns:

Markdown output.

Return type:

str

static convert_to_pdf(filepath: str, output_dir: str) → str

Convert a document to PDF using LibreOffice.

Parameters:

  • output_dir (str) – Path to the output directory.

Returns:

Path to the converted PDF file. Throws exception on failure.

has_unsupported_content() → Tuple[bool, str]

Check if workbook contains content that we don’t support. Only checks for images and charts, allowing all other formatting to be quietly lost in conversion.

Returns:

Tuple indicating if PDF conversion is needed and the reason why.

Return type:

Tuple[bool, str]

static convert_excel_to_markdown(excel_path: str, include_hidden_sheets: bool = False, lose_unsupported_content: bool = False) → Tuple[bool, str]

Convert Excel file to Markdown if possible, otherwise indicate PDF conversion needed.

Parameters:

  • excel_path (str) – Path to the Excel file.

  • include_hidden_sheets (bool) – Whether to include hidden sheets in the conversion. Default is False.

  • lose_unsupported_content (bool) – Whether to quietly lose unsupported content in the conversion (if False, will return failure when file contains images and/or charts). Default is False.

Returns:

Tuple indicating if conversion was successful and the Markdown text.

Parameters:

  • table_range (TableRange) – TableRange object representing the table range.

Returns:

Markdown-formatted table.

static clean_and_reorder_elements(elements: list[dict]) → list[dict]

Clean and reorder elements, dropping page headers and footers and reordering body text sections as needed to ensure uninterrupted cross-page flow within sections.

Parameters:

elements (list[dict]) – List of elements to clean and reorder.

Returns:

Cleaned and reordered list of elements.

Return type:

list[dict]

static get_image_bytes(image: Image, output_format: str = 'PNG') → bytes

Convert a PIL Image to bytes in the specified format.

This function takes a PIL Image object and converts it to a byte array in the specified format.

Parameters:

  • image (Image.Image) – PIL Image to convert.

  • output_format (str) – Output format for the image (default is ‘PNG’).

Returns:

Bytes representing the image in the specified format.

Return type:

bytes

static pdf_to_images(pdf_path: str, dpi: int = 300) → list[Image]

Convert a PDF to a list of PIL Images.

This function opens a PDF file, renders each page as an image at the specified DPI, and returns a list of these images.

Parameters:

  • pdf_path (str) – Path to the PDF file.

  • dpi (int) – DPI to use for rendering the PDF. Default is 300.

Returns:

List of PIL Images representing the pages within the PDF.

Return type:

list[Image.Image]

pdf_to_markdown(pdf_path: str) → str

Process a PDF file to extract elements and output Markdown text.

This function reads a PDF file, converts it to images, processes each image with an LLM, and assembles the returned elements into a single markdown output.

Parameters:

pdf_path (str) – Path to the PDF file.

Returns:

Markdown text.

Return type:

str

static starts_with_heading(content: str) → bool

Check if the content appears to start with a heading.

This function checks if the given content starts with a heading, either in ATX or Setext style.

Parameters:

content (str) – Content to check.

Returns:

True if the content starts with a heading, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool
